dreisoft.tresos.datamodel2.api.attribute

Class AbstractAttributeTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • dreisoft.tresos.lib2.platform.AbstractExecutableExtension
      • dreisoft.tresos.datamodel2.data.attribute.AbstractAttributeExpr
        • dreisoft.tresos.datamodel2.api.attribute.AbstractAttributeTest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.eclipse.core.runtime.IExecutableExtension

    public abstract class AbstractAttributeTest
extends dreisoft.tresos.datamodel2.data.attribute.AbstractAttributeExpr
    This class is used to implement new tests for an Automatic Attribute of type Expr. The attribute can be used in the XDM in the following way: 

        <v:var name="MyVar" type="INTEGER">
       <a:da name="INVALID" type="Expr" test="MyTest(TestArg)"/>
     </v:var>

    "MyTest" in the above example defines the name of the expression to be called. TestArg is an arbitrary string that is given to the method doTest(java.lang.String, dreisoft.tresos.datamodel2.api.model.DCtxt, java.lang.String[]) as parameter.

    AttributeTests can be defined either static via the Eclipse extension-point dreisoft.tresos.datamodel2.plugin.attributeexpression or via AttributeTestRegistry.

    Copyright (C) Elektrobit Automotive GmbH - All rights reserved

    Since:
    2008.a

      • doTest

        public abstract java.lang.String[] doTest(java.lang.String expressionName,
                                          DCtxt ctxt,
                                          java.lang.String[] arguments)
        This method is the actually test expression of the attribute. The method returns the values of the attribute when evaluated against the given ctxt which points to the node that hosts the attribute.

        Use dreisoft.tresos.lib2.api.log.Log to log info messages, warnings and errors.

        Parameters:
        expressionName - The name under which the expression is registered
        ctxt - The context pointing to the node that hosts the attribute
        arguments - The arguments from the test expression
        Returns:
        The values or null if there are no values.
